tips.title: Be Specific About the Subject and Topic
tips.description: Mention the exact subject (Physics, Chemistry, History, etc.), chapter name, and specific concept you need help with.
tips.example:
Instead of: 'Explain electricity.'
Use: 'Explain Ohm's Law from Class 10 Physics, Chapter 12 - Electricity.'
tips.purpose: Helps the AI focus exactly on your syllabus and level.

tips.title: State Your Learning Goal
tips.description: Clearly say what you want to achieve - understand a concept, get examples, solve problems, or revise.
tips.example: 'I am struggling to understand the process of photosynthesis in plants from Class 11 Biology. Can you explain it step-by-step with a simple diagram description?'
tips.purpose: Guides the AI to structure the response for your need.

tips.title: Ask for Real-Life Examples or Applications
tips.description: Request examples linked to daily life to make textbook concepts relatable and memorable.
tips.example: 'Give me three real-life applications of the concept of 'Pressure' from Class 9 Physics. How is it used in tools like knives or syringes?'
tips.purpose: Enhances understanding and aids in answering application-based questions.

tips.title: Request Breakdown of Complex Processes
tips.description: For processes (e.g., nitrogen cycle, chemical reactions), ask for a step-by-step breakdown.
tips.example: 'Break down the steps of the 'Nitrogen Cycle' from Class 12 Biology into a numbered list with a one-line explanation for each step.'
tips.purpose: Makes complex information easier to digest and memorize.

tips.title: Ask for Comparisons and Differences
tips.description: Prompt the AI to compare two similar or often confused concepts to clarify distinctions.
tips.example: 'Compare and contrast 'Distance and Displacement' from Class 9 Physics in a table format with two points each.'
tips.purpose: Useful for mastering definitions and avoiding common mistakes.

tips.title: Prompt for Mnemonics or Memory Aids
tips.description: Ask the AI to create a catchy mnemonic, acronym, or trick to remember lists, sequences, or formulas.
tips.example: 'Create a funny mnemonic to remember the order of reactivity series for metals (K, Na, Ca, Mg, Al, Zn, Fe, Pb, H, Cu, Hg, Ag, Au, Pt) from Class 10 Chemistry.'
tips.purpose: Great for exam preparation and recalling lengthy information.

tips.title: Ask for Problem-Solving Steps
tips.description: When stuck on numerical or derivation problems, ask the AI to explain the solution step-by-step.
tips.example: 'Solve this numerical from Class 12 Physics, Chapter 2 - Electrostatic Potential: 'Calculate the potential at a point due to a charge of 4x10^-7 C located 9 cm away.' Show all formulas and steps.'
tips.purpose: Helps you learn the method, not just the final answer.

tips.title: Request a 'Explain Like I'm 15' Summary
tips.description: Ask for a simplified summary of a dense paragraph or concept from your textbook.
tips.example: 'Explain the 'Central Limit Theorem' from Class 12 Maths (Statistics) like I'm 15. Use a simple analogy.'
tips.purpose: Cuts through jargon and builds foundational understanding.

tips.title: Ask for Potential Exam Questions
tips.description: Prompt the AI to generate important questions or identify key topics from a chapter.
tips.example: 'Based on the CBSE pattern, list 5 most important 3-mark questions likely from Class 10 History Chapter 1 - The Rise of Nationalism in Europe.'
tips.purpose: Aids in focused revision and exam readiness.

tips.title: Combine Tasks for Deeper Learning
tips.description: Combine multiple requests in one prompt for a comprehensive study session.
tips.example:
'For the chapter 'Acids, Bases and Salts' (Class 10 Chemistry):
1. Give me a one-paragraph summary.
2. List 3 key properties of acids with examples.
3. Write the chemical formula for three common salts.
4. Suggest a simple experiment to show neutralization.'
tips.purpose: Creates a complete learning module in one interaction.
